iOgfBIQtYf20UUO4ApFTYg.text: Great customer service AMAZING FOOD make sure you get the PoBoy sauce it's heavenly on everything that's fried!

04VH-dfPJofAuQBjGBjnrQ.text: Do not allow the bad part of town nor the looks on the outside of this diamond in disguise fool you! This place is great hands down. Don't miss out... I promise you'll love it.

7G7vRdbob6viM6Kx5ngIYg.text: Went here for a quick lunch with a colleague.  Great place.  The food was fast and fresh.  When you walk in, you are greeted by a large fish counter.  You can order your fish and take it home or have them cook it for you.  There is also a small menu you can order from and plenty of large picnic tables to sit.  I chose the fried shrimp Po Boy and my colleague had the Lowcountry Boil.  We both chose dirty rice as our side.  Mine was delicious.  The Po Boy sauce was awesome and the dirty rice was nice.  Not oily at all.  My colleagues boil was great too - 10 boiled shrimp with potatoes and corn.  Will definitely be coming back here!  Great find!

_jZ-h_JP5_iee6vAsaTJYQ.text: This place is awesome. You need to try it. Fresh salmon is the best. Good seasoning great value. Friendly team.

cNduWWvB1WGGDcEmqgjq5Q.text: If you're hungry, don't drive by this place without stopping! Prices are right and the po boys are DELICIOUS. I order mine Flounder, regular, and with the po boy sauce and it has just the right amount of zing to it. And good luck trying to get through the whole sandwich - it's huge!

BhlHY4_fmIo1sGa5YHjAcg.text: I'm so very excited about this place. Having come from New Orleans, I know what a po boy is supposed to be. And contrary to popular belief, it ain't just another name for a submarine sandwich. The bread has to be light and fluffy, with a very thin, almost brittle outside crust. Po Boy's has the staples: an array of fried fish, shrimp, even oysters or roast beef. The best part is that the fish is fresh and fried to order, you see the whole fish on ice in the front fish market area. I assume you can also just buy fish here to cook yourself, like any normal seafood market. I had the flounder po boy, cajun seasoned, dressed with lettuce, tomato and their cajun mayo remoulade sauce. It was hands down the best po boy I've had since I left Louisiana. I also had a lowcountry soup, with sausage, shrimp and corn and it was good. But the star of the show was the killer sandwich. I'm so happy to have found a place where I can order a real po boy. I'll be back, and probably pretty often.

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried oyster po boy. So damn good.
Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Couldn&#39;t wait to take a photo before tearing into this thing.

OukRzVKd9m_M3AE9vLYfsA.text: As a life long NOLA fan, I always wish there were decent places to find good cajun and poboys outside of Louisiana and South Mississippi.  Poboys Low Country Seafood Market is just that place.  It honestly would be about a 3 star in NOLA or 4 star in Mississippi, but I will happily give them 5 stars for Charlotte.  A decent portion of protein flavored well, taste sauces, fresh veggies and most importantly great bread.  If you want a good sandwich be sure to check them out.

Phg1TnvuN3TRnIQpM74xyA.text: The food is on point. I got a shrimp po boy the last time I went. The shrimp was seasoned perfectly, and they weren't stingy with it at all. xqjlrNRDEbz6euxG6c2now.text: I would highly recommend this place! It's a restaurant and fish market all in one. It's doesn't have the fishy smell which is a plus. I order the shrimp Po boy. You have your choice of 3 different seasonings. Salt and pepper, Cajun, and regular. I tried the salt and pepper and the Cajun, both are great but I like the Cajun the best. The fact that I pick my seafood then the cook it is a plus. Food was very well seasoned. If you are looking for great fried fish/season come here. They have a regular customer out of me!

lAtGH7YFBVLJE1J-Qr3ilw.text: This is a new favorite of mine, featuring quality seafood & po boys at decent prices. I had an oyster po boy from here (market price, ~$11) and it was amazing. The oyster itself was fresh, but surrounded with a perfectly crisped, cajun-seasoned crust. These babies are clearly handled with love and thrown onto a well-made hoagie roll.  But if you're not into oysters, there are plenty of other options, such as the classic shrimp po boy. In addition to sandwiches, you can buy fresh seafood here by the pound (raw or cooked to order). Lastly, the people working here are so friendly! It encourages me to come back again soon.

nIe0dT3fZpRdVG69VNIcTg.text: I will start off by saying we are born and raised in New Orleans, HOME of the Po Boy, but live in Charlotte, NC!!!  Ok!!! So, I would definitely not say it was nasty!  We had the low country boil, Fried shrimp poboy, Fried catfish po boy, side of Red beans (came with no rice), and  Side of fries. We got the Cajun seasonings on the seafood for the Poboy's. They were both very tasty but didn't have enough seafood like we're used to.  New Orleans boasts on OVERSTUFFED Poboy's and these definitely were NOT overstuffed or even plentifully stuffed for that matter.  The red beans were seasoned well but were definitely NOT New Orleans Red Beans & Rice and the fries were at least salted.  The low country boil was seasoned really good but I personally do not like andouille sausage which is the stereotypical sausage people associate with New Orleans cuisine.  It was wayyyyy better than Mr3crabpot in Charlotte!!!!!

pRZiCYYnv7GWq4HQxW0cbA.text: omg!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! clean!!!! fresh!!!! awesome seafood options!!! clean fry grease ... you can taste it immediately!!! sweet but not too sweet hush puppies!!!! fried okra fried to perfection but not overdone so you enjoy the freshness of the okra!!! awesome staff!!!!!

The different seasoning options (which we made sure to diversify) ended up being not so different from one another which was a little disheartening. Ultimately, though, everything was decent,  just not earth shattering. That customer SERVICE, though, bar none! mDiedKpIqo95Mqyq2uhekQ.text: I loveeeeee this place! The Cajun shrimp po'boy reminds me of the authentic ones in New Orleans! Definitely get the po'boy sauce too! I always receive great service when I come in.

KjEyaYFwKxzdNGpjKvd9Iw.text: I didn't want to do this review because then the secret would be out but from the number of cars in the parking lot I think I'm too late.  Poboy's is INCREDIBLE! KxcK0veGX34AZfllViC7-A.text: Amazing, Fresh, And Good!! I was not expecting such a well seasoned and cooked right meal. You get to pick out your own seafood and they cook it to order. The only thing that I can say is wrong is the pricing. It's all weighted and they charge your to  look them by weight. So it can get pricey if your hungry like I was.  I totally recommend this spot with every Seafood loving bone in my body. The food would be more enjoyable at home so get it to go. They have done in but the place was not clean, the bathroom has a door code for EACH time you enter it and it was not clean. But dont let that stop you!!

My first thought was I'm going to have to wait forever to get my food. I was wrong! The line moved so fast and was so organized. After I ordered my food I probably waited 10 minutes (if that) and it was ready. Everything was correct and they made sure of that when they brought it to me. I ordered the soft shell crabs and they were absolutely amazing. I cannot wait to go back again!

You definitely get your money's worth here in taste and the amount of food they give you. I was only able to eat half of my order.  I will be back for my seafood cravings!

It was almost too much to take in but worth every bite.  Even though it was late and the place was busy, the folks behind the counter were very attentive and made you feel right at home welcome.

PLt0qW5gQ0AVJvkyfA5AQw.text: The freshest seafood in town. ANNDD they cook it for you. I will be back more times than I should.

PMJH1XBg2klChOfCuOpl_g.text: Had a shrimp po boy and fries.  Great sandwich, friendly people and reasonably priced.

CdQJT3YZ64kaDPFPyfzXcg.text: Definitely will come back when we're in Charlotte. You get to choose your own fresh seafood & it comes out real quick. Portion sizes are great too.

gq8uhOEQW4AYT06aiiS40Q.text: After a long morning of digging through the bins at the Goodwill Outlet my stomach was talking to me and seemed to be telling me that it couldn't wait the 15 minutes it would take to get home but that I would need to find a closer option. So I did what any respectable hungry person would do in that situation.....I opened up my Yelp! app and did a nearby restaurant search...Ooooh what is this?! A po'boy spot?! But where? and why had I never spotted it before ( I would later find out because it has only been open for 3 months). It was an off time of day, 4pm, so I rang em' up to check that they weren't just a lunch spot (yelp didn't have their hours listed). The friendly voice on the end of the line assured me that they were open until 8pm. Yessss.   Already having been hooked by eying a pic of the oyster po'boy I knew this was what I was getting. But the offer to " You Buy We Fry" for the various fresh fish was also a very tempting option for future visits. You get several options for the fry of the oyster. Cajun, S&P and regular I believe were the options. Then you can choose po'boy sauce or mayo as a sauce. I chose cajun and the po'boy sauce. Duh. The very enthusiastic girl behind the counter assured me that the combo I chose was also her favorite. I almost got one of the made-in-house sides, green beans perhaps, until I was informed that the sandwich was HUGE. Next time.  The size was indeed over ample, and the taste was on point. Perfectly seasoned fry on the oyster, not to mention a generous amount of the plump suckers, 8 If I am not mistaken. The bread was great as well, perfect balance of soft and chewy. It could have easily been split between two people, but not being one to cower away from a challenge, I finished the entire thing solo. However, not without regrets and the need for a nap.. zzzzzzzz

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. The oyster po boy is huge

b6DD1zdnj9bvrEkjUa45-A.text: This is our once a month lunch stop after shopping in the Value Village across the street and while im not the biggest po boy fan I find their sandwiches to be quite tasty. I would love a more generous portion of shrimp, the bread over powers. But since I have nothing to compare it too I honestly dont know if that's just how it's supposed to be. The staff is always pleasant. The place is always clean. You would never think you're stepping into a fish market.

r2gMn-ze2H5oFqxC12EYRg.text: Finally we have a place to eat when we visit Charlotte.  The staff is hands down the friendliest I've encountered and very helpful with suggestions.  The very sweet lady who took our order remembered us from our visit two months prior.  The food...OMG... I've ate a lot of fry house style seafood living in the South but their twist on it is so delicious.  The Po sauce on their poboys is da bomb! And their fried fish and shrimp is some of the best I've ever eaten.  Their okra is frozen but you'll mistake it for fresh.  Get the fruit punch then switch to Lemonade so you don't have to choose. Don't forget dessert.

gtnpRNiq5y4BsvQIrw1xgQ.text: I was in the area and stopped by for lunch a few weeks ago and the line was long but moved quickly nonetheless. The young lady who took my order was pleasant and patient. I had the flounder Po'Boy, mac and cheese, and green beans. I planned to save half of the Po'Boy but that did not go as planned once I bit into it! The sides were just ok, but I would definitely return for a Po'Boy.

hpgYciJ37Dx2QpYLq12FHg.text: Awesome food good service and great priced. I love alligator Tail. Theirs is fantastic. I'll be returning very soon.

065yBMzeQCE1NE8o83HD_A.text: Love this place and the fresh available food. Always packed so be prepared. The soft crab Po boy was amazing.

yHWQW47PM-RSd_iZfODEjw.text: We can't get enough of this place Let me tell ya'll. The shrimp po boys are EVERYTHING! And that Po Sauce! LAWD HAMMERCY!  We haven't eaten inside yet but will probably do it soon. We've just placed our orders inside and taken it home or the few times we can get someone on the phone (no shade cause I know ya'll are busy) and taken it home but I will say the inside looks very nice and inviting.   So happy to see PoBoys on Freedom Drive. I live in the area and have tired of the other restaurants around. Can't see myself getting tired of good fresh fish tho. My only negative and to me it isn't a biggie (Ya'll can have all my five stars) is that I had a hard time finding if they were open on Sunday or not. Luckily I can just swing by on my way home and look at their sign.   Growing up my father would go to the outer banks and fish and bring it back to fry. This place reminds me of that. Nothing like good FRESH fish. And they season it to perfection. Please go here if you're a fish lover. Even if you don't live or venture to the west side much, make a special trip. It's worth it.

aF8A8FriidTvbGtixOTc7Q.text: This seafood restaurant and market has awesome seafood the people are extremely friendly  the Cajun shrimp it was perfectly seasoned and my husband had the whole flounder and it was very fresh and very tasty We will definitely be back

dXjaGOVzHL3jtSVepFFccA.text: After all the hype I decided to try them out today. I must say I'm very impressed. Everything was perfect. I got the Flounder PoBoy and Chicken PoBoy along with a side salad. The Salad was even good, they make their own dressings so that's a bonus with me....I'm a happy customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Everything was perfect. Will definitely go again.

YINQMLsBFkPLXBnFS-M_wQ.text: I really enjoyed the experience of picking the fish and preparing it for me. I had the shrimp po boy it was seasoned well with fresh lettuce and tomatoes,then I tasted the red snapper that my cousin ordered it was awesome flaky and melted in my mouth.The atmosphere is great..

GOp1R_RnlsewO7qkyYcxwQ.text: This place is so good. The best seafood in Charlotte hands down! The best po boy in Charlotte hands down! I've visited here maybe 7 or 8 times since they've opened and every time has been great. They season their fried fish and shrimp just perfectly. My favorite item on the menu right now is the catfish po boy. Please don't pass on the po boy sauce...it takes the sandwich to another level.   I've tried the low country boil, shrimp po boy, catfish po boy and I highly recommend all of these. Plus the service is always friendly. Check this place out!

l3xKO-TzdiOw2lYQEtvMCw.text: Way more than just delicious Poboy's.  There is a full display of fresh seafood that you can purchase to take home or have them cook it for you.  Service was excellent and the menu looks great.  Worth multiple visits.

CXAfClyiCi3ZYvB8oYkJJw.text: As a pescaterian I'm very particular when it comes to seafood. With that said this is one of the beat seafood restaurants I've been to here in Charlotte. The did is fresh and delicious. The Po-Boys are to die for abd that's no exaggeration.   Excellent food! Go check it out.

M4lKn1nmpVJW4HR8dkCq9Q.text: Not my usual Stomping grounds .... but I was hungry and looked at Yelp and it was well rated and sounded good. Well --- it is excellent ! Great service / clean as a pin / nice folks .... I had the "spicy" Shrimp Po Boy ---- super fresh ingredients and id say equal to the best I've had from N.O.  Give it a try - you won't be  disappointed!

N1g8IhftGwy3zf2mSHA0IA.text: Excellent food and service! Can't wait to go back. I'm so happy that the owner opened this restaurant in Charlotte!

PITSdj_cKYTY-ISiH4DN2A.text: First time here was on this past Friday wanted to try something new so i stopped in about 20 mins before closing time and it was packed so I knew they must be doing something right!  They have a pretty good size display to show the fresh fish they have, like others have said you can have fish whole to take home or they will fry it there for you. I think they have like 4 different options for the seasoning. The Po boy is the star for this place with the Po boy sauce you cant lose. Dont sleep on just having them fry something else up also because it is Good! I was mad i didnt order more the first time. Yes its on the West side but dont let thay stop you from missing out on this place! I just wish i was closer to it because i will be making multiple trips back!

YdGmWFAPt6KlUvCLTvAt_A.text: This place has the best shrimp Po Boys I've ever had and I'm kind of an expert on them.  Having had some very good ones in Louisiana and Mississippi I would have to say that if these were not the best Po Boys they are equal to the ones I have had I the Deep South.  I strongly recommend you try this place.  It's not expensive unless you are like me and have to try everything.  Lol!

R-XYr1xvrGSwdz3k1x6Kxw.text: Saw this on Yelp while still on plane and came for early dinner on our first day in NC. Deserves  five stars and more for fresh and perfectly fried catfish, best ever hush puppies, great okra, and a low country boil so well prepared that even the potatoes tasted special. In addition to the good food the employees were helpful in explaining the menu to us.  We shall be back!

YR2tg7hw6ry_YFd2JsGsBw.text: Walked in and was immediately greeted! This place is truly a gem. I ordered a piece of whiting which was huge and 4 scallops and my bill was only $9! This is the definition of a lot of bang for your buck! Will be returning soon!

xAhhZRNgi0QBSdcR-SCzFQ.text: Wow, what a great lunch. There were plenty of people there when I walked in and now I understand why.  Everything was delicious, had the Po Boy flounder, the bread was crispy, the sauce was delicious, and the fish was fried to perfection even...the french fries were awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

IzmRzYLq2dppxIhpYH-koQ.text: So after reading another's review I was convinced I needed to go here and try out the fish. I love fish and hate cooking it because the entire house smells like it until it airs out. First let me start by mentioning the owner is very hands on he comes out to everyone's table ask how are they enjoying the food and if it's anything you need. The setup here is like a fish market, so you could actually go in and order fish, crab legs, etc to go. I ordered the flounder Po boy sandwich with fried oakra and lemonade. Everything was ok it wasn't sink down in my chair good but it did the job.  I Will revisit and try some other things on the menu in the future.

MOk37qq0ALYMoImWFyapMQ.text: The fish is always hot and fresh.  This time I had the shrimp PO Boy. The shrimp was flavorful, crispy and not over battered. They put the sauce on the bottom of the sandwich which is perfect. They also gave extra sauce on the side. Between the sauce and the shrimp was shredded lettuce and sliced tomatoes. Although it was a shrimp PoBoy it's the bread that steals the show. That french bread is EVERYTHING. I lived in Louisiana for 2 years the bread here is real deal

dFWID7TT9tY5BpH2a3e4jQ.text: This place is a hidden gem in Charlotte! The menu is incredible (not available online to my knowledge), the food is fresh, the service is top notch, and you get free refills on sweet and/or lemonade.   For $13, I got the shrimp Poboy (cajun style), fried okra (small is plenty to share for two), the mac & cheese, and a lemonade.  They are so well priced and the food was delicious and fresh. I will certainly be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

yW25lAOZ6vxLSqNh5d1icQ.text: A low key place with satisfying food.  When you enter the building (from the Freedom Drive side)  you go left by the seafood display cases and someone at the counter will take your order.  Menus are on top of cases.  You give them your name and they give you a ticket stub with a number.  You have a seat (usually in the chairs by the door).  When they call your name you go to the till and order your drink, if you want one, and pay.  Then you can have a seat at the table and they will bring your food to you.   The tables are picnic type and communal (other people may sit with you at your table if it is busy).  Enjoy you food and then bus your tray to the bins.  There is another door at the rear of the dining room to exit if you wish.  There is one co-ed bathroom.  It has a key pad and you enter the code to get in.  The person who is busing the tables can tell you the code.  The food is simple and good.  The vibe of the place reminds me of the old time North Carolina beach feel.  Easy going and relaxed.

j9fKfA0t-UX0UHAaiW1x0A.text: Best I have ever had! Not too spicy, a ton of flavor and amazing service! They were kind and fast! It was lunchtime and they had my order in minutes! It was more than delicious! I'm obsessed!

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. This food was AMAZING! There isn&#39;t a piece of food left on my plate but the shell!!!! Get this!

W-KJFdk1LNvh0StABZfFaQ.text: Absolutely outstanding. 5 star establishment. Shrimp poboy is everything you need in a poboy, perfectly fried shrimp and an amazing roll, well dressed. Any of the fresh fish fried up is also excellent. The service is top notch, they always remember your name. It's always a good day if you're going to poboys.

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

1JxgnOOGeuoX5E91a0vD_w.text: I have no idea why it took me this long to review. I have been here a few times already. The staff are very nice and feels family owned . Half restaurant and half seafood market. So you have a choice to getting your raw fish cooked or take home. They have the BEST Poboy's around. Their poboy sauce definitely reminds me like the one I tasted in New Orleans. They have a few TVs that you can watch while you eat. Nothing classy but cafeteria style seats and good food! Always get the salt and pepper shrimp po boy and the Cajun seasoned gator bites!

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp po boy.

Rrj4BwR6vAUMi4FyLG0lfw.text: Pretty darn amazing honestly.  Hate that it took me so long to check it out.  If I'm ever in the area I'll be grabbing a shrimp po boy with fried okra.  Although, I am curious to see how all they prepare such beautiful seafood.  Get the shrimp poboy, have it breaded however you like.  Get some fries or fried okra and grab a tea while you're at it.  Thank me later.  That's it.  That's more than enough food for the first time trying this place.  The poboy is huge!  The shrimp are perfectly cooked, the bread was about exactly what I was looking for.  Spot on, one of Charlotte's best restaurants IMO.

PT51HgOKZrOSfgtmn81xwg.text: -First time visit -Long line, very busy, but that's usually a good sign -No clear posted menu, asked for one -Ordering and paying process unclear -Food was worth every bit of the discomfort and confusion!!!!

h7u-vzooCYkZondu0woLcg.text: I have finally found my seafood heaven! The options here are ridiculous at first I was overwhelmed with what to choose. I heard so much about this place but being that it's a bit of a drive I never was in a hurry to go a friend invited me and I am so happy I went. I ordered 1/2 pound of catfish 1/2 fried shrimp fried okra with Mac and cheese. You can tell they are very popular and the amount of food given was so much. I knew as soon as my plate came I would need a to go box. My friend let me try his flounder and I will say that was my fav so far cooked to perfection. The only thing that disappointed me is the Mac and cheese. I am a huge fan of the dish and the one I tried here will not be ordered again. However, I will say that it didn't turn me away from the restaurant still my favorite seafood place in Charlotte so far and I will faithfully take that drive.

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Got the flounder po boy this time with some mac and cheese on the side.....I miss it already
Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

SjczwffIIOHcw6nl8qGImw.text: I'm from the DMV, which is North East of Charlotte and grew up on eating  good seafood so believe me when I say that this place has the very best seafood in Charlotte. The only thing missing is Maryland blue crabs. They have all kinds of fish, and seafood, and you can get it raw, steamed, broiled or fried with different seasonings. We had fried tilapia, whiting, perch, oysters, shrimp, scallops, and fries. OMG everything was so good cooked to perfection. The batter, the seasoning, so good. And dont forget to try their special homemade sauce. Be prepared to wait in line because the secret is out! The place was pretty clean when I was there. I do have 2 complaints the table we sat at needed to be wiped off and there is only one bathroom. We will be back! I will take some pics on my next visit.

UY4WUY3A3LI6-APn7DfJXg.text: Great place, a must visit! The prices are very fair, and the food is absolutely delicious. Be sure to get a sweet tea too! The staff is very friendly, and was happy to help us tourists out.

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

-fFNSYsdPlIupXMG6w6zOQ.text: Half seafoods market and half restaurant.  Look for the menus on top of the cases featuring the fresh seafood you can buy fresh or cooked. Look for the signs to order. They give you a ticket stub and then find a seat. May need to share table when it gets busy. Chairs against the windows are for to go orders. They will call your name when your order is almost done. You go up and pay at the registers. The second time you hear your name called is to bring you food to the table. At that time you can ask for the condiments.  Finally a place you can get good Poboy's besides jakes good eats. What makes a good Poboy's? The bread!!! Nice and soft, but not heavy. Just strong enough vessel for the fried seafood.  We had the oysters and soft crab Poboy's. Choose between regular, salt and peppers, or Cajun batter.  Most people order the fried fish when I looked around   Sides: we had the sweet potato okay, hush puppies , and cracklings (fried pork skin) we had Cajun seasonings.   Will try fried okra and country boiled next time.    Definitely recommend this place.

N3VETs6pMLLFyusVinBomw.text: When I first pulled up, I wasn't sure what to expect. Once I entered into the place, I didn't want to leave. I love the interior decor. It's super cutesy and nautical. I loved that while I knew it was a fish market, it certainly didn't smell like one.  I've certainly had better po boys after living near NOLA friends. However, I will not discredit the fresh offerings found here! The service is extremely personable with a flare of southern hospitality.   The prices were reasonable. I will certainly be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. I love the hush puppies, the Cole slaw was pretty good, and the po&#39; boy was pretty fresh.
Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

LzrXbsiz4jSto3aN0V4TwA.text: Today was my 1st time visiting this place , amazing customer service, my food was ready in 15 min and was delicious. This place will definitely be in my seafood rotation.......

oPdHoNpw8fosvw2mtM6vTw.text: Good Food!  Great Service!! The shrimp P.O.-boy was great , coleslaw was sweet and fresh

w65SpOSoThGfX9E6KDVHaQ.text: Clean and very good customer service. The workers were all pleasant. The prices are good considering it is seafood with nice portions.  Shrimp Po Boy was hot and fresh, yet needed a tad bit more seasoning.  I love okra and the okra here was only good with the sauce. Note for next time to try the hushpuppies or red beans.

fUqHZf3yJWYWb_8paAT2Gg.text: I really wanted to like this place after reading all the amazing reviews. Freedom Drive is kind of lacking when it comes to really good restaurants. Anyway, this place is right next to the Community Thrift Store and there appeared to be plenty of parking. I snagged a spot right at the front during lunch time so that was a plus. Inside there's a counter where you can order various kinds of seafood either raw or cooked (priced by weight), and they also have a menu of sandwiches, salads, soups and sides. To the right is a dining area with a nautical theme. The guy (medium height, sandy blond-ish with a beard) who helped me was really patient in explaining all the options, which I appreciated. He was the bright spot in this whole thing. I ordered a shrimp po boy with Poboy sauce, which he said he would put on the side, and BBQ pork cracklins. When the young woman (short, with short hair) brought out my food, she asked if I wanted sauce. I was confused because I wasn't sure what else needed sauce that I'd ordered. She said since I ordered a poboy, it already came with sauce. Cool. I don't need extra. I'll say that she didn't really have an attitude, but she wasn't as pleasant as the guy who took my ordered. She just seemed bothered that I wasn't sure whether or not I wanted (or needed) extra sauce.   ...of course I get home and there's NO sauce on the sandwich (like the guy and I agreed) but there's also NO sauce on the side. Just dry. It's annoying because someone else mentioned getting home and having a dry sandwich- I should've checked the bag before I left. Oh well.   The sandwich itself was fine, the shrimp was crispy and seasoned well. Sure would've been nice to have some kind of sauce on it. The cracklins were salty and I just didn't feel great about eating them. I'll give them one more shot before making a final decision, but for now it's three stars.

gg7LZvcq68H7Mhm9TaNPHA.text: Living down south it's difficult to find a True fish store but Poboy's is just that! It's rare when you can pick your fish fresh NOT frozen and have it cooked for you.  And the variety is great! A must try! My favorite is the oyster poboy, my husband loves the catfish poboy.

aMzLJvDLXpi8HMuOREzo1g.text: Have been a few time and the food is always good. My favorite is the shrimp po boy. My daughters have tried the fried fish and that also is very good, nice selections of seafood.

-bKJKfDxekuWENRyZYYO9w.text: If you are interested in a no frills restaurant with quality and fresh seafood, Poboy's is your place! I have taken my family, friends and even coworkers here - and always leave raving about the food. The Poboy's are amazing but don't forget to take advantage of the cooked to order options. I prefer to get a couple pounds of the crab legs accompanied with the large shrimp in the Cajun batter - remarkable!

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp poboy

vTkus9w_Vs8O4Cbxbu1Wjg.text: I said in my tip that Saturday's are for checking out bookmarked joints and this Saturday was a winner, winner Po Boy lunch.  Hmmm... 1 star for not rhyming.  Seriously though, this place is on point in all respects.  Prices, friendliness and most importantly, good food.  Now, I'm only going on this one visit personally but all these other 5 stars can't be wrong.  Beyond the good quality fried shrimp on the Po Boy they got the bread right.  Little crisp on the outside, soft and chewy on the inside.  I went kind of traditional with mayo but there is their Po Boy sauce along with ketchup, tartar and hot sauces available and i pretty much tried it all.  It was a beautiful day and I sat outside and in about 7 minutes, out came a guy with a tray of goodness.  I had the fries (crinkle cut) and slaw as sides and both were decent companions but the star was the sandwich.  They've got a seafood market too where the product looked fresh and the prices seemed reasonable.  They'll cook selections for you or pack it to go so you can do it up at home.  Po Boy's isn't in the neighborhood for me but it's a guarantee I'll find reasons to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Po Boy. Damn good!

qxwW0O0X4Pq1Zo0UpnlRkA.text: WOW! I'm pleasantly surprised. This place was recommended to me and all I can say is thank you Seyi!! I tried red shrimp and swai fillet for the first time and they are my new favorites. I chose the light salt and pepper seasoning for both and it's just right. I'll have more than enough to take home for dinner. I'm mad that it too this long for me to come. The food is fresh and they prepare it for you if you want. They have seating for dine in or you can get it to go. This swai is amazing! Flavorful without being fishy. I chose Mac and cheese and green beans for my sides and birth are decent. The green beans are salty so if you're trying to cut down on your salt intake don't get these. Highly recommend when you need really good seafood cooked to perfection

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red shrimp, Mac and cheese, green beans

z_F659NZZ9y19dB-lw07qA.text: Very flavorful food!! Restaurant was appealing and has a good atmosphere. Service was on point! I enjoyed the fried oysters and Cajun seasoned Soft-shell Crab PoBoy. Will definitely visit again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Alligator Bites!!
Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Food was bomb!!!

dBfuyOWzAMZVEbSb-OJ_AA.text: I've been here twice before, and today was able to bring my hubby for the first time. He grew up along the Mississippi River, so he ordered whole catfish and said they were very good. I got the Canadian perch, five fried oysters with the Cajun seasoning, and three large shrimp  Cajun. Red beans, fries  and Mac & Cheese.  The red beans are always good and the crinkle fries are really great.  However, I have to say today the mac & cheese was really terrible, I even had them put some Cajun seasoning on it to give it more flavor. But it tasted like Mac with no cheese and slightly sour milk! But the customer service in this place is amazing for a counter operated service.  Immediately when I told her about the Mac, they asked me what I wanted instead, and made me a fresh batch of hush puppies.   Just a few days ago I tried another seafood market that cooks and prepares the food for you closer to the southside Of Charlotte.  The customer service from the owner was an atrocious, and the food was just OK.  If you've never been to this place you've got to try it! We will definitely be coming back for more great seafood, and Fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun oysters,  &amp; Canadian Perch filet Red beans and milky not cheese at all Mac.
Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soft shell  crab, 4 previously frozen oysters this time of year. Large
Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh tasty  shrimp. Medium and large Cajun seasoning.

ATZCxkGrGGoJXWPatG5z3w.text: My first visit I chose to order the Po boy sandwich, you can choose to have the shrimp fried in three different ways: regular, salt and pepper, or cajun. I went with the cajun. The sandwich comes with a po boy sauce which is mayo based with a kick. Overall the sandwich was great!  If you're looking for fresh seafood this is the place to come. Not only is it this place a market, but they will also cook what you choose. I'll will definitely be returning to this spot!

HHwaYik98kuFGAt5KQ2Xjw.text: We recently got lunch to go from here after hearing that it was good. I got a shrimp poboy (salt and pepper breading) with poboy sauce. My husband got the catfish poboy (Cajun breading) with poboy sauce. He also was excited to see Cracklin on the menu and ordered a small size of them with bbq seasoning.   Wanting to try different things, we split our Poboys so we could sample both. We agreed that both were fresh and super tasty. I would have liked a little more poboy sauce but it was otherwise, perfect. I liked the shrimp best and my husband liked the catfish best.   My husband was a bit disappointed that was was called cracklin on the menu is actually pork rinds. He liked it (although his wished it had more bbq seasoning) and said he would get it again but prefers actual cracklin and had his hopes up.   Overall- tasty and reasonably priced. We are fans!

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. We split our Poboys so we could sample both - half shrimp poboy and half catfish poboy (and of course, tons of Texas Pete)

FmpfIosSaPLInld5wja7-A.text: At first glance, it might not seem like you have arrived at the right place - I mean it looks like somewhere you can grab dinner (and the kind you eat then and there, or at least take out not the sort you have to make yourself). In fact, it looks like an old fast food joint. Surely they have something to eat. But it says market. And when you walk in, they have a bunch of what appears to be fresh fish, and nothing on the menu that would seem like you can order it to eat.  So... What gives? Just wander up like you have no clue and they'll be happy to help. This is the approach I took and it works wonders.  The staff here is amazing - some of the friendliest and most helpful ever, and patient like you would not imagine (incidentally, they do have menus where you can order po boy sandwiches, they are just usually sitting on the cases containing the fish). Those staff will help you through the menu, or they will help you with something to go.  Then the will give you your number, and bring the food out to you when ready, and be ready - it is a heck of serving. Sandwiches are not small. Sides are perhaps a bit on the small side, but you didn't come here for the sides, you came for the po boys - that's what is on the sign, after all. The one you should definitely try is the cracklins - much better than the kind you'll get in a bag at the store, and with some cajun spice on them, well worth it and they go great with the sandwich.

YrFko2tUqo9BawRd1g9sjA.text: Absolutely love this place - have gone here many, many times & have NEVER been disappointed. Normally get the cajun shrimp po boy sandwich and hush puppies - both are beyond delicious. Have had the coleslaw which is also great - it's chopped/diced versus a stringy-er version. The atmosphere is relaxed - they have picnic style tables where everyone just sits together - people are super friendly & have never had an issue sitting with anyone. The staff is great - friendly, attentive. I recommend the po boy sauce - we have it on the hush puppies. You won't regret trying this place & once ya try it, you'll be a regular too!

x0R41CEW3RNLdG9k6CLuDA.text: Seafood market with an overwhelming selection!!  Choose your fish/seafood, say how much you want (4 shrimp, a couple of oysters, some scallops...or maybe fried catfish?) and then choose a couple of sides.  Sit down and get ready for your feast.  Everything made-to-order fresh, perfectly seasoned and delicious! Very casual. Lots of fun. Only sad moment:  a server told us about the desserts, we were drooling, only to learn that all the desserts were sold out!!  Ah well, I was sooo full, and now something else to return for!

gVbFKEGvfM5-p8af-DrLXQ.text: I was at work and a customer reccomended this joint..and I didn't go. He saw me again and asked if I had gone and I said, "no.." he said, "You've GOT to go to Poboys!" I SEE WHY.  literally the best fish sandwich I've ever had in my life. Lovely atmosphere, plus super fresh and fast service. s/o to the cute bus boy that hooked me up! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. The glorious flounder po boy! Ck the stack of homemade sauces and BOMB fries!

e6x4AaMp1Zt_2ZUse97wlQ.text: Great staff, friendly and helpful.  The food, was mediocre.  The flavor seems to be the same for a lot of their dishes and I found it way salty on all the counts I've been there (3x).  The Oyster Poboy wasn't fresh, I didn't expect it to be, although the salt covered the "not so fresh" taste.

kOTnOMNXggCkn-vPAH9TpA.text: My friend told me about this place and she raves about their Poboys. So I had to give it try. I had the Swai boy boy and it was good. My boyfriend tried the shrimp poboy and needless to say he didnt say a word but umm umm good while he was eating. They have different sauces to put on. Get the homemade poboy sauce. I got extra sauce. They also sell raw seafood here which I can take home and cook. But they good think about this place is it doesn't smell fishy. Its nice and clean, the waiters are attentive and they had steady customers coming in. I would say give it a try. I want to try the different poboys, so I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. shrimp po boy
Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Swai po boy

beR2cQ5vrFZ0JCyktEW30w.text: Ordered a Cajun shrimp po boy with po boy sauce!  Oh my god it was awesome!  The hush puppies amazing too!  I will be going back!

5Kq589zIKXsAu0ia72mCcg.text: Best shrimp po boy I've ever had, everything was delicious even the bread used which makes a big difference. Recently discovered and have been at least 6 times. Each time I say I want to try something different I end up ordering the shrimp po boy cajun seasoned with po boy sauce. Can get other sauces for your table, so no worries there. Sweet tea is SWEET!! No fishy smell, clean, excellent sanitation score. Staff is Very friendly and helpful. Definitely will be back for both raw and cooked to order fish! Been bringing relatives and friends there...secret is out!! :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red beans &amp; rice as one side - on menu separately but they will mix together as they recommended to me for one price. Shrimp po boy cajun

ZxIbbdM38pQun5MBrwDmMg.text: You know what????  We were on our way back to Charlotte, NC from Columbia, SC.  From my sons military graduation at Ft. Jackson, as noted in my "Cajun Queen" review.  So, we were kinda pressed for time as our flight back to OKC was pretty soon, but wanted one last Low Country Seafood treat before we left the Carolina's.  And let me tell you...PLCSM did not disappoint! It was our first time going to a seafood market where you can pick out your fresh seafood and have them cook it to order while you wait.  Of course you know what my wife ordered!...yes., shrimp and fries. But, I got the oyster po' boy...sooo good!, sooo fresh!, sooo tasty!!!(I did add a couple of her fried shrimp to my po' boy, sooo right!)  After our meal we hurried out to get to the airport for our flight, both of us commenting, that if we missed our flight...it was sooo worth it!

muqShEcE6kz_kgD7xZP_lQ.text: I was referred to Po Boy's by a friend. Those who know me, know that I'm a foodie & a picky eater....  Today I finally made it to Po Boy's! I drove all the way across Charlotte to see if it was as good as I heard it was.   I walked in starving after my workout w/a confused look on my face. Dino immediately welcomed me & asked if this was my first visit. I told him I was recommended, but I wasn't sure what was good... He said everything is good (I've heard that before). He explained the items I asked about. I decided to go w/the shrimp, mac & cheese, & yams. Dino weighed my fresh shrimp, asked how I wanted them seasoned, what sauce I wanted & he made it happen.   The food & service exceeded my expectations! The seafood was so fresh, the sides were as well & they were cooked to perfection. The atmosphere was nice, the theme of the decor was perfect & all of the employees were so friendly & knowledgeable. I can honestly say, I was not expecting the level of service & experience I received. I received a customer service experience comparable to some of Downtown's 5 Star establishments from the time I walked in the door. The employees work so well together as a team & it's such a welcoming atmosphere. It's a very clean friendly establishment (even the bathroom).   The food was so good, that I placed a to go order for later & told all of my friends about the new Queen City gem that I found today : ). Po Boy's is some of the best fresh seafood I've had in Charlotte (top 2).  If you're a foodie & you enjoy delicious fresh seafood & amazing customer service, stop by Po Boy's & treat yourself to the experience you deserve!   Thanks for a great 1st experience. I'll be back (this week)! ; )

YLqbkrLmAaRslGN609wvqg.text: This is still by far my most favorite seafood place in Charlotte!  Food is always fresh and the service is always great!

BOd3SlYtl618MLnCHnR9qw.text: First experience at Poboy's Low Country Seafood and I was very pleased! Great food selection and very pleasant, patience, and knowledgeable staff.  A coworker and I went to Poboy's around 4:00 pm (late lunch) so there was not a crowd. When we went in we explained we were first timers which prompted the staff to explain what is offered and served. Be prepared to see fresh seafood when you walk in. It feels like a seafood market...and it is as well as a restaurant. You select what you want and they prepare it for you! Did I say the food was amazing?!!! They have selections from oyster, several types of fresh fish, including flounder, croaker, all the way to jumbo shrimp and alligator! We selected the flounder Poboy sandwich. It was very flavorful. We also had shrimp and oysters! You can choose flavors to have your food prepared in salt n pepper and Cajun. The sides were also good; fried okra, macaroni ( not a lot of cheese but good flavor, and pinto beans( rated as okay). I will definitely be back to visit!

6Xb8mmRdjnouNXAlZKAFHg.text: PoBoys is a no frills, laid back seafood market and restaurant. A you buy, we fry spot. Nothing fancy, just good down south seafood and fixings.   Ambience: Super chill, located off Freedom Drive. The front of the restaurant is the seafood  market. It offers fresh fish, shrimp, crab legs and crawfish. They offer whole fish, or cut and cleaned to order. The prices vary buy fish type and whether you're having it cooked there.  The seating is family style, picnic tables. So, get to know your neighboring diners.   Food: They have an extensive selection of fish. Whiting, red snapper, flounder, porgy, brim, croaker and more. The shrimp come in various sizes. If you dine in they offer cajun, salt and pepper, and unseasoned batter for your seafood. They also offer tail on/off options for the shrimp. The sides are tasty. Hushpuppies, cole slaw, fries, fried okra, etc.  Oh, and don't for get the sauce. Cocktail, tartar, hot sauce, po boy sauce....something for everyone.   My go to is a piece of whiting, 6 large shrimp, both with cajun batter. Along with a small side of hushpuppies. For around $8, you can't beat that.    If you're craving fried seafood, stop by PoBoys.

3sJ8Fp3rOEpOJ53KHocKAg.text: PSA I'm not a seafood fan but the Cajun Shrimp Poboy is amazing!!!   I was pleasantly surprised by the flavor and crispiness of the shrimp. I also am not a big fan of mayo, tater or creamy sauce like the Poboy's sauce and the sandwich was actually really good with out any sauce.   For my order today I got one fried Cajun Shrimp Poboy, plain pork skins and some fresh catfish fillets.  I got the sandwich and my mom ordered the other items. She devoured half of my sandwich. I wish I could have eaten more of the ting golden pieces of shrimp. My mom liked her items and even stated that the prices for the fresh fish is cheaper that a place down the road.   I will definitely be back and hope to try more of their menu in the future.   Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market  3022 Freedom Dr Charlotte, NC 28208 Tuesday April 9, 2019 2pm

YSEylT_-mEwoPLk1ci7Pdw.text: You know you're southern when this no frills comfort food place is a completely acceptable after church/funeral/etc. meal. Stopped in here with family to split a pound of flounder and a pound of shrimp. A no frills place this establishment is both a market (buy seafood raw by the lbs and take it home) and a restaurant (buy it by the lbs and ask them to boil, fry, etc.) and eat it in house or take it home.   We ordered the flounder fillets, 26/30 shrimp, and some hushpuppies (completely forgot  they did fried okra or I would have been all over that). Anyway, the flounder was thick and flavorful fried to perfection and the shrimp honest were the sweetest shrimp I have had in a long time. I literally cannot sing the praises of this place loud enough.  The comfort food this place offers and the unpretentious ambiance just kind of warms you soul. Seating is limited in the form of picnic tables inside and outside. I absolutely love how southern this joint is; if someone is sitting at one end of the table don't be afraid to ask to sit at the other and take sometime making a new friend. Felt like I was at a family fish fry talking to so many people like we knew each other.

D-gZd8K6b4s4_FA7RL3U3Q.text: Fresh seafood market. U buy they fry or take it home to cook. The poboy sandwich is very popular here and tasty.  The bread is kinda thick I never finish it. Order at the counter and then they bring it out , fast and very friendly service , if we weren't here visiting from Las Vegas we would be back , wish we could find this kind of seafood in Vegas at these prices.

xy4fT2CfHOyv-rtv9IpmcQ.text: I am in love. Like seriously in love! Moving from a small town to Charlotte, I've been on the search for my new "go to" spots for my favorite foods. Japanese and a Fresh Seafood Market being at the top of the list! With Poboys I got a Fresh Seafood Market AND Fresh Cooked Seafood in one stop!! I'll admit, I was skeptic going in because of past experiences for 2 reasons. One being I don't want to eat in a place that smells like raw, expired fish. The 2nd being I didn't want my seafood to have that "fishy" taste. You know as if they just pulled it straight from the ocean, didn't rinse it & just put it in the fryer? Yeah, I didn't want that.  So I walked in and all I was hit with was the aroma of seasoned fresh seafood. Nice! Then I was confused. Is there a menu? Do you order the cooked seafood in a specific area or both at the same time? I didn't know where to go or what to do. When it was my turn I walked up and asked for direction on how to order and for a menu. She was very patient as she explained everything to me. They have a small menu where you order PoBoys and a few other small items, however, if you want other fresh cooked seafood you simply pick it out and tell them how you want it cooked! Your price is based on what you get and how much it weighs. Do you want 10 shrimp? They'll cook 10 shrimp! I was excited. They let me taste the soup of the day and the slaw and then I placed my order. You can have your seafood cooked Regular Salt & Pepper, Cajun or Lemon Pepper.   I just went regular and ordered a piece of Croaker & Flounder, a pound of Large Shrimp, a cup of the Seafood Gumbo, Slaw & Fries, all fried hard! They hand you a ticket and you take a seat until your name is called to pay. While you pay you are asked if you'd like a drink and any sauces. Then you take a seat until they call your name again for your food. To preserve the crispiness of my seafood I always poke large holes in the top of the container, however, it would be nice if they let it rest for a moment before throwing it into the container. I would be willing to wait the extra time to avoid soggy seafood.   But the food was delicious!! perfectly seasoned, perfectly fried & fresh!!! I did a happy dance as I ate. I love their slaw, and I don't usually like restaurant slaw. The only thing that was not so great were the fries. They were thin crinkle cut fries that didn't have that great a taste. I wasn't a big fan of the croaker, but only because i'm country where all we cook our croaker in is cornmeal and not seafood breading. So I returned another time and order uncooked croaker to take home. What I noticed on this visit was that the prices were steep! I guess that's the price you pay for Charlotte? I snatched up 4 Croaker. All of their selection was very large. I miss my old seafood market where I was able to grab a container and tongs and pick out my own fish where they had various sizes. So I may still search around Charlotte for something similar to that. But overall PoBoys is a WIN!

FPtxx1SVWgKkIDxKir0bbg.text: I found this restaurant on Yelp's suggestion after cruising down Freedom drive for a food truck. When I realized that I mixed up the trucks schedule and hadn't ate anything since the day before, I was ready for anything considered edible or better. To my surprise, Po Boy's was so much more than what I was ready to accept when I was at the brink of culinary defeat. Cheap, simple, and delicious!  When you first walk in, you're immersed in somewhat of a full on seafood market. To be honest it's a little unclear as to where you're supposed to place your order if you're there just for lunch or dinner. For what I gather you can place your order at the seafood counter or at the register near the dining room. At the very least, they didn't tell me otherwise so that's what I did. I got the shrimp Po Boy seasoned Cajun style and a spicy remoulade sauce. I also got a Mac n' Cheese on the side. After paying and having a seat in the small waiting area, I got my food in about 7 minutes.  Considering I was famished and feeling rather grouchy, I opted to eat in my car. I did notice that the dining area was very clean and tables were being tended to regularly so I wouldn't hesitate to dine in next time. The Po Boy was de-lish. Hoagie had a rich flavor without back-seating any of the shrimp, which were breaded and cooked perfectly. I loved the Cajun seasoning which emphasized flavor over spicy. The remoulade sauce provided a contrasting creaminess that played nicely with the very fresh tomatoes. Nothing poor about this Po Boy at all. Low-key perhaps, but aggressively superior to any other Po Boy I've had in Charlotte.  Mac n' Cheese was pretty good. It definitely wasn't as complex as the Po Boy and that's okay. Creamy, cheese, and al dente pasta that was seasoned well. For the price, this is a steal!  I'm so blown back by this unassuming joint. Get yourself one of these magical Po Boys soon!

iS3WAlR0VqYKAAYoGwRaBg.text: It took me way too long to try this place and when I finally did..... I was at a loss of words. I came back to eat here three days in a row! There is more to order than appears on the menu, any of the fish on display can be fried or grilled and sold by weight. As delicious as each of the fish and fried seasoning are (Cajun, salt & pepper, and regular), I knew the side items wouldn't let me down. But my soul was not prepared for the SIDE OF YAMS! PHENOMENAL! If you don't know what to get and you want to try it all- order the Cajun po boy, Arnold Palmer tea, side of okra and get the yams as dessert. It will not disappoint.

wauW9jmTwhg2-4vqCzXoGg.text: This place is definitely a must try! Let me just say that the PoBoys will just knock your socks off. What ever you order will be delicious from the catfish all the way to the softshell crab you can't go wrong. I usually get it Cajun style with the PoBoys sauce they say it is spicy but I can barely notice the heat, if you're nervous about the spicy you can order it plain w/ mayo eithier way you can't go wrong.   Now as far as the fish market part Im usually really mad at myself when I come here and I forget to bring a lunch bag with an ice pack. The fish here is always fresh like eyeballs are not cloudy and fresh off the boat! And let me tell you the fish has to sell out all the time because of the amount of people coming in and out just blows my mind.   Definitely worth a trip for a bangin PoBoy or some fresh fish here in the queen city.

q3w6zZKM7wtATFdtTYYFLQ.text: I visited Poboy's yesterday for the first time and was extremely impressed!  Kudos to Brandon, Matt and Shamari for awesome customer service from the ordering process to receiving my food.  I ordered the Porgi, Argentina shrimp, rice and beans and fried okra (regular and Cajun fried).  It was soooo delicious!!! MLr2KNr2RuASBviC1y8f6g.text: What a hidden gem!  Hiding on the west side, down freedom drive, is a great seafood restaurant.  It's also a seafood market, with a good selection.  Don't be fooled by the seemingly limited menu, they can and will cook anything you want.  If they have it in the market, they will cook it for you any way you like.  My wife got 1/4 pound small shrimp fried Cajun style, and really enjoyed it.  The breading was the perfect consistency, not to thick.  I got the low country boil small plate and everything was delicious.  It comes with 10 shrimp, potatoes, corn and sausage.  The seasoning was strong without taking over the dish.  Everything was cooked to perfection.  We just moved to the West side and will be making this a regular stop.

sXj1UMZEDNQOSHocTzKcEg.text: I love how the seafood is displayed, beautiful, just beautiful, then i noticed they sell fresh fish by the case, those who know me, im a foodie, Yelp, Foodspotter, CONNOISSEUR.  Please check dem Po Boy's. PS: GREAT EATS.

rz9LAaM9vyzEqywnpeQCvw.text: From the minute you walk in the door you know the place is good.  Welcoming staff, fresh seafood right up front.  The concept is awesome.  Buy seafood cooked to eat there, cooked for takeout, or raw, to go and cook for yourself.  I got the low country shrimp boil, for $8.95, and couldn't resist a piece of salt and pepper catfish on the side.  I bought lunch for a friend, we each had drinks, and my tab was $20.  Ordering and paying is done at the counter, but cooked meals are delivered to your table and tables are bussed regularly.  The food was way above average from what one might expect from a simple place as this.  I wish I would have thought of this concept myself!  Wonderful place.  Highly recommend.

1aDTqBdwSux-dGhBUs0KEg.text: My husband loves poboys. That's why this place is getting 3 stars. He did not love his poboy. We both got the salt and pepper whiting poboy. He said it was okay.  I liked mine. The cole slaw was good. The hushpuppies were delicious! I liked my poboy. It was the first one I've ever had. Their tomatoes are good. It made the sandwich so good. They were sweet.

J6MR5vQkXRxNBRGngcqzdw.text: Came to Charlotte for business and tried this place out...absolutely awesome!! It's an adorable little seafood market with nice tables to eat in. Very clean, and the staff is very friendly. Has a menu with simple selections, but you can also order any of the seafood either raw or cooked by the pound. Prices are really cheap for the quality! I'm beyond happy. Tried the oyster po boy, fried Cajun croaker, boiled Cajun shrimp, and dirty rice. Had basically 2 more meals to take home after eating. A must try if you're in Charlotte!

N3Hy-UCtutkl3NuLuJWQhA.text: I must admit, PoBoy's has impressed me beyond belief. I can't believe we were afraid to walk in here lol I was completely blown away when I found such a fresh fish market so close to home!!! You can purchase whole or have it gutted and even fried! They have regular seasoning or Cajun seasoning. Everything also looked very fresh with clean containers and ice everywhere, they take their precautions. I'll be picking up fish fillets from here moving forward.   As for the food, also wonderful! I ordered the fried shrimp Poboy while the bf had the fried chicken poboy. We also got a small side of okra to split and a small banana pudding. We were having a movie marathon and really didn't want to leave so we stocked up. And stocked up indeed as the portion sizes here are insanely big. The Poboys are served on a hearty 9" hoagie roll while the "small" fried okra side we got was enough for 3 people. We were very stuffed before even opening the okra. First off, I love the Cajun seasoning for your fried items! Everything was freshly fried without excess oil or grease, nice! The sandwiches were packed with our protein of choice with lettuce and tomatoes. The okra... Has got to be the best fried okra I've ever had hands down!!! Like shut the front door good! So fresh on the inside, I'm guessing they do not use frozen okra, and perfectly crispy on the outside. The banana pudding was very good as well, apparently they bring in desserts from local bakeries.   The staff was wonderful, she took time with us and explained everything since we were noobs. Great people. My recommendations: Make the Po sauce a little spicier, had to add siracha, and invest in steam/heat friendly takeout containers. The styrofoam will melt! Fan them open in the car ride home so you don't eat plastic! Regardless, we will for sure be back for more! Yay for PoBoy's Low Country!

qzn0mtrYvI41Cx5Fo-ayhQ.text: This is the first Po Boy sandwich I have had in Charlotte and it did not disappoint. The cajun seasoning and Po Boy sauce were on point. The low country boil was also amazing and had just the right amount of kick to it. I will definitely be referring friends to try this!

TSE5wXTJJDJtB4KcxNIzKg.text: I love this place! I had FRESH fried shrimps, fried flounder, dirty rice and coleslaw and the shrimps and fish melt in my mouth and so Delicious! I would recomend to everyone who loves seafood, please go there and you would never regret. You go order and get your order in a few minutes. People are so friendly, environment is clean and comfortable to eat. :)

UeAI6aNRv6cOhHY_vdLZhQ.text: This is a great seafood place where you can pick out your seafood and they'll cook it for you.  They get really busy so expect to wait.   Seating is limited so I always carry out. I have been here several times and service is consistently friendly. There's no place like this near me so I have to drive 15 miles to get my fix.

KE5dF0tIqGtZYnrXMZTxOw.text: Such good food! We had the low country boil fried oysters and red beans and rice.  The young lady that helped us was amazing. She gave awesome suggestions. I'd just landed in Charlotte, this was my first stop. I definitely will be back. Fresh delicious and fast.

CXlaaISjEoDoncqpqTksmQ.text: Really glad I find this place. Being from a waterfront city it was hard not being able to get fresh seafood like I was used to. This place reminds me of the seafood markets back home. If I could say anything it would be about the charge for cooking the food. Back home they charge $1 per pound and here they charge $2, but ultimately I guess it is what it is. The food taste great so that takes the sting out a bit for the pricing. I guess I'm just spoiled and have to get used to the prices here. I've been here more than once and definitely recommend you give them a try.

yybmkTY9Daa4LsI804Ia5g.text: Had a great lunch at Poboy's. Food was delicious. I like the fresh market, chose combination what I want to eat they cook it. I had flounder, shrimp and fries. All good. Quick service, friendly staff. I will go back.

33BMoGDo9_hOy_x5gH0iRA.text: Very good food. Friendly and very helpful staff. I would strongly recommend this place to anyone.

6YGmtmEXFSceWWKCBr5mRw.text: My goodness!!! 5 stars all the way!! First off I love the atmosphere!! My servers were great! So this is a seafood market/restaurant....you come in and get your seafood by the pound raw or cooked!! They have an array of fish from bass, flounder, perch, to croaker (which is my favorite) to shrimp and you can get it Cajun, salt and pepper or any other flavor....it was so so so good to me!!!! I recommend this joint if you are in the area!!!

h3ft6z0DP4MilnzG9xlg8Q.text: Been looking for a good shrimp po' boy and I found it. Every meal is made to order. Awesome.

D6bXOh2jQr7bLUpR3StJBQ.text: This place was referred by my husbands coworker. First, just let me say I had my doubts when he said it was on freedom drive. LOL! Once we arrived plenty of parking, restaurant very busy, everyone smiling and happy. We were immediately ask if our order could be taken. After a few minutes of looking over the menu and by the way everything sounded good. They have all types of seafood you could possibly want (of course it's all fried). They also have fresh raw seafood that you can buy by the pound or by the case, we decided on the Po boy shrimp sandwich & the Po boy flounder sandwich. Can I say the shrimp Po boy was amazing! The shrimp was fried to a perfect crisp, it was just spicy enough, not too spicy just the way I like it! The sauce that comes on the sandwich was that extra that made you stop and appreciate all of the wonderfulness in your mouth. I was a little disappointed there were no broiled or steamed options on the menu. Did I mention orders are made fresh. No food setting under heat lamps!! if you're looking for the best fried seafood in Charlotte, definitely hands down Po Boys on Freedom Dr.  is your place. Check them out!

Photo of Poboy's Low Country Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Flounder Po Boy

9QS5Qkj5gLrh5T66WMoCPw.text: Poboy's is Charlotte's best kept secret. The service is friendly and fast and the food is always piping hot! Moreover, the prices are beyond reasonable. I placed what I thought was a fairly large to-go order today, and when I arrived for pick up I had to ask the cashier if the total was correct as it was such a good deal. I have not yet ordered any fresh seafood from the market to take home and prepare but plan on doing so soon. The restaurant is clean and tidy and doesn't have an overwhelming fishy smell at all. I've only known about Poboy's for one week and have already visited four times if that's any indication of how good it is. As a recommendation you cannot go wrong with any of the fish fried Cajun style, a side of fried okra, and hushpuppies.

svsjHt57Hic3s-au2VzQmw.text: This was such a friendly spot. The "country girl" came out in me. I had the catfish stew and had fish fried for my momma.   Everything was delish. When I'm back in town I will be back. The staff was so very friendly and patient. Try the catfish stew when you come. You can purchase to cook or have them do it for you. They do a wonderful job and you house does not smell like fish.  Two parting words:  Go.  Eat!!!!

Ug-jAFNXG0HIvu_MhPw2gQ.text: Ordered shrimp and hush puppies.  My wife and I had a full meal for around $13.  Great price as we just ordered a around $5 worth of shrimp each.  I got cajun and she got salt and pepper.  Both of us left very happy.   I would stop in here in a heart beat for the price.  They make it fresh so be ready to wait.  I took the kids down the street for some fast food while my wife waited.  It worked out perfectly.

Se0JO70vfDInENtXmN9LgA.text: I'm so glad to find this place (Thanks Yelp!). The bread is so fresh and so is the seafood. I also like the taste of their PoBoy Sauce, it has a little kick. I have had the shrimp here and it was so good. Do yourself a favorite and check this place out.

CMFqRfNhPdaLWymhEQh4Cw.text: Best food and best service I experienced in a while. Brandon was so patient and helped us a lot. That's very rare now to see customers service like theirs!!! We enjoyed the food we ordered poboys shrimps, poboys alligator, and pork skins, and shrimp boil was excellent and so dilicious! The owner even take time to greet us when he learned that we are also from new jersey

7UzFCShDhvxPlwHC3PML7A.text: Yelpers....thank you! I was jonesing for a good fish Sandwich or Shrimp Po Boy and after seeing the amazing reviews I had drive over.   Pros: cajun shrimp po boy! It's a large sandwich, the sauce took it to the po' boy level. Location is clean, doesn't have that stuffy Fried foods smell & smog and they offer a large selection of fresh fish.   Cons: I just killed my po boy sandwich and enjoyed my visit - not a con in sight!

OvyDdNhhit4FQtzLQacnZA.text: Came back again and more of the same.... awesome fried fish! But a game changer occurred, ordered the Cajun shrimp by the pound and they loaded that box up! Great taste and servings!

UjpwpOC17YQULXgWG14Prw.text: I'd never had a po'boy before, but I'm sure glad I did at this little gem!  The staff were so friendly and were very helpful when making recommendations for my first po'boy. I ended up going for the fried shrimp po'boy and a side of cracklings. The sauce on the po'boy was delicious. (I'm partial to mayo-based sauces anyway.) The fried shrimp weren't greasy at all, and the breading was light and flavorful -- really just perfect. The bread was great, too. Very soft with a crispy crust.  If I lived in the area, I would LOVE to buy fresh seafood from them, too. I feel spoiled with seafood up here in Boston, but the South definitely has seafood worthy enough to be on par with what we have up hear!  Do stop by this place if you're looking for a tasty Southern seafood meal and pleasant staff to boot!

l4qOn63VqWentbF5M-jg6A.text: This was a pleasant surprise that I find via Yelp (surprise!) when searching for a good lunch spot. You first walk in, and it looks like just a seafood shop, but then you look at the menu and they tell you they will even fry something up for you from the case. I came for a po-boy, and I got a catfish po-boy. My only complaint was the basic hoagie roll . Wish was a little more like a traditional New Orleans po-boy roll. But otherwise, great fry on the fish, and good sauce. The fried okra was AmAZINg!! Portions are big, so come hungry!!
